issues.title: Doesn't send
issues.body:
so far I have tried both send smpt settings and nothing sends, or how do you know something sent.  I don't understand I guess.  Can you give me more information on how to and what to expect?

Diana

issues.title: 404 error
issues.body:
I don't know why I get a 404 error when I view the campaign.  Can you help me?

Wish you had a faq or document page to get information on how to use this plugin.

Thank you,
Diana

issue_comments.body:
Hi Lew,

Thank you for your reply.  I did get a single campaign to work and finally
the post digest, but I am confused on how it determines what to pull in.
Is it a certain time frame before the scheduled send?

Happy Holidays,

Diana

---

diananashif.com

On Sat, Dec 20, 2014 at 10:10 PM, Lew Ayotte notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Hi Diana,
> 
> The best way to test is to create a list with your email address in it,
> then create a campaign and select the list you created as the recipient.
> When you publish the campaign, it will send it. If you don't receive it,
> then something went wrong. There are a lot of reasons why email wouldn't
> send, from a misconfigured server to being blocked by your web host. It
> would be hard to say without knowing how your site is setup.
> 
> Thanks.
> Lew
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/PigeonPack/pigeon-pack/issues/4#issuecomment-67760457
> .

Hi Lew,

Yes, that is working too, but what is the difference between an each post
and a post digest campaigns?  Do I need the start and end loop merge tags
for both?

image merge tag?

diananashif.com

On Mon, Dec 22, 2014 at 4:27 PM, Lew Ayotte notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Each post means that if you write a new post, it is automatically emailed
> out to all your subscribers. A digest collects all the new posts for the
> given period, then emails the collection on the scheduled time. The
> start/end loop are only required for digests.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/PigeonPack/pigeon-pack/issues/4#issuecomment-67904529
> .

Thank you and Happy New Year!

Another question:

I can send using the built-in wp_mail() function but can't using the smtp
settings.

We have a managed server at SingleHop and the settings they require are:
Outgoing Server:     server3.standupgirl.com

```
SMTP Port: 465
```

Authentication is required for IMAP, POP3, and SMTP.

Here is what I have tried, any ideas for me as to why it won't work?

​

issues.title: Free version responsive?
issues.body: Are the newsletter templates in the free version responsive? If not, is there a target date?

commits.message: Modifying pre_user_query and adding sortable column functionality to campaign type

Adding column sortability on campaign type column, adding check to make sure old campaigns exist before trying to send mail, adding check to ensure a single user doesn't get sent multiples of the same email
Updating for deprecated WP_Widget use in WP4.3
Fixed issue with HTML entities not displaying properly in email subjects
Fixing method call for profile update
Fixing typo in SMTP Authentication setting
Fixing issue causing post loop to not merge properly
Adding ability to use the Post's Featured Image in a campaign
Adding español language files, thanks to Andrew from Web Hosting Hub
moving actions, fixing multiple publish bug
Fixing typo in campaign save, adding proper HTML error codes to wp_die statements, fixing error in calling static method in shortcodes
updating help text for custom merge vars
Fixed bug in adding new subscribers AJAX
Updating Pigeon Pack icon and Special Thanks
redux the pigeonpack_hash function again, checking for duplicate hashes
change priority of script enqueues and default to in_footer when possible
Updated hashing function, changed how subscriber hashes are updated
fixed undefined variable error in widgets
Updating Help Page and CSS, fixing misnamed functions
more robust post status transition checking, do not add trash => publish posts to digest, but add an action hook to override this
check against false in array_search calls, removed after_delete_post, use pigeonpack default settigns for footer info if none set in list
renamed all functions in class.php to remove pigeonpack_ (not needed), added delete post check
Added comment for future note on dealing with previewing campaigns, some code format updates, increased flush-rewrite rules delay
added MERGE help meta box to Campaigns page, renamed post_loop merge variable, fixed references to old site url, updated minified scripts, removed references to premium support from readme.txt
Renamed files, changed how wp_post campaigns are initalized and uninitialized, fixed foreach bugs, re-minified JS
Renaming verify functions, merging dropdown recipients functions, adding missing error messages
Missing { from messed up merge in pigeonpack-campaign-post-type.php
merging lots of changes... added ability to select multiple recipients per campaign... fixed -list.js...

Fixed all phpDoc comments, modified WP_User_Query to default to ON, modified Subscriber Role check (WordPress <3.5 doesn't create the WP_User_Query object as WP_User objects), made double optin/unsubscribe processing code a little more efficient, added help documentation, fixed i18n text domain call, fixed some missing i18n calls

HTML -> PlainText converter in place, added processing of forms without AJAX on frontend (just in case), added shortcode documentation on help page, added a few do_action and apply_filters for future anticipated addons. Need to finish API integration and CSV importing
working on text/html options, finished user settings and email links, required footer content, etc.
removed bad files, added unsubscribe option and optin option for WordPress users
Added Pigeon Pack subscribe form widget, fixed add_subscriber function hash and hash function, created new user-settings file to add Pigeon Pack options to WordPress user profile
Replaced old plugin name with Pigeon Pack and changed some Description wording
Initial commit to add PigeonPack to development branch of new git repo...

issue_comments.body:
Hey MarkRR1, There technically aren't really any "templates" in Pigeon Pack yet. I've simply been relying on the WYSIWYG editor built into WordPress for generic formatting. But adding templating functionality is next on the list of thing I'm working on. Not really sure when I'll have anything released though.

With all that said, what is offered in Pigeon Pack for free should be pretty responsive :).

Hi diskwizz,

We don't really have any tutorials yet. But all you need to do is create a new campaign and publish or schedule it. Let me know if that doesn't help. We'll get some videos up as soon as possible.

That's it... "publish" sends it. Preview doesn't really do anything, if you refreshed your permalinks, it might show you the title and text of campaign depending on your site's theme. When we add templates to the mix, the preview option in WordPress will be more useful.

Hi Diana,

First, go to Settings -> Permalinks in the WordPress dashboard, this will clear your permalink cache, which should resolve the 404 error you're getting. However, the view option won't really do much for you anyway, except for simply show you the message in your theme's WordPress template. The button is just there because that's what WordPress has. When I add templating in the future, I'll override the view so it shows in a Pigeon Pack template.

Thanks.
Lew

Hi Diana,

The best way to test is to create a list with your email address in it, then create a campaign and select the list you created as the recipient. When you publish the campaign, it will send it. If you don't receive it, then something went wrong. There are a lot of reasons why email wouldn't send, from a misconfigured server to being blocked by your web host. It would be hard to say without knowing how your site is setup.

Thanks.
Lew

Hi Diana,

When you set a campaign as a digest, it should present you with the scheduler to set the frequency (http://l3w.us/images/2e6ef9.png).

Happy Holidays to you too :)
Lew

Each post means that if you write a new post, it is automatically emailed out to all your subscribers. A digest collects all the new posts for the given period, then emails the collection on the scheduled time. The start/end loop are only required for digests.

Hey Diana,

That's was great idea! So I added it and just pushed out version 1.0.9.

Thanks.
Lew

Hey Diana,

It's technically possible, but I don't have a CSV import add-on built for PigeonPack yet. It's one of the many things I plan on doing for Pigeon Pack. Not exactly sure when I'll get to it though.

Thanks.
Lew

Hi Diana,

Did it require setting any Encryption level and did you add your Authentication username/password?

If you can, send me your SMTP credentials to support@pigeonpack.com and I can test it myself.

Thanks!
Lew

Hey Diana,

I just pushed out version 1.0.10, it should fix the problem with the "Yes, use SMTP authentication" setting not saving. I think this will fix the problem for you. Let me know if it doesn't help!

Thanks.
Lew

Hello.

1) I don't have any import scripts yet.
2) There are no limits built into the plugin, the only limit you'd have would be with your mail provider.

Thanks!

Hi, thanks for the reply.

I created a campaign. Then clicked publish...

Then what?If I click preview it takes me to my wordpress page but says Page Not Found.

Thanks, Pete

From: notifications@github.com
To: pigeon-pack@noreply.github.com
CC: diskwizz@hotmail.com
Subject: Re: [pigeon-pack] How to send emails (#2)

Hi diskwizz,

We don't really have any tutorials yet. But all you need to do is create a new campaign and publish or schedule it. Let me know if that doesn't help. We'll get some videos up as soon as possible.
